name: Pinochle - Single Deck Quiz / Test | Pinochle | 10 Questions

questions.text: This should be a simple one for pinochle lovers...how many cards are there in a standard pinochle deck?
questions.explanation:
48.

	A standard pinochle deck includes a total of 8 aces, 8 kings, 8 queens, 8 jacks, 8 tens and 8 nines. You can make a pinochle deck by acquiring two standard decks of playing cards and simply removing the twos through eights! Of course, the easier alternative is to simply purchase a pinochle deck...

questions.text: In game play, which card ranks the highest in the game of pinochle?
questions.explanation:
ace.

	Strangely, after the ace, a ten is ranked highest...defeating a king, queen, jack and nine, respectively.

questions.text: Since the game is called pinochle, we had better discuss what a pinochle is. What exactly is a pinochle?
questions.correct: Queen of spades and jack of diamonds
options: Jack of hearts and king of clubs
King of hearts and ten of spades
questions.explanation:
Queen of spades and jack of diamonds.

	It is always most pleasing to find a pinochle in one's hand, but even more exciting is the double pinochle! A regular pinochle is worth a mere 40 points, but a double pinochle is worth 300!

questions.text: Which of the following cards is not a 'counter'?
questions.explanation:
Queen.

	Counters are cards that are worth points during game play. While aces, tens and kings are worth points, queens, jacks and nines are worth nothing. Don't forget to drop counters on your teammate's aces!

questions.text: A 'round robin' includes all but which of the following?
questions.explanation:
Jacks around.

	A round robin consists of kings and queens around, which also results in marriages around. A royal marriage is a marriage in the trump suit, while common marriages are non-trump marriages. A round robin is worth a total of 240 points.

questions.text: What is the term for the combination of points that a player bids on following the deal and prior to game play?
questions.explanation:
meld & melding & to meld & melds.

	Meld is only a dirty word when you don't have any...

questions.text: How many points would you receive for a double round of aces?
questions.explanation:
1000.

	Only a double run (two aces, tens, kings, queens and jacks of trump) is worth more at 1500. I drool at the thought of being dealt either one!

questions.text: Which term is used when a team fails to earn enough points to reach the bid made by the winning bidder?
questions.correct: set & to set & to go set & setting
questions.explanation:
set & to set & to go set & setting.

	There's nothing worse than the humiliation of going set, and nothing greater than the satisfaction of setting your over-zealous opponents!

questions.text: Sometimes lower valued cards can win tricks, a particularly satisfying event for a player. What is the phrase that relates to this occurrence?
questions.explanation:
Making it walk.

	Once the aces have been exhausted, it's a free for all if each player has remaining cards in a suit.  At that point, lowly cards (such as queens and kings) can win tricks!

questions.text: Which term is used to describe the situation in which all players pass, in which case the dealer is forced to take the bid?
questions.explanation:
Dumped on.

	It's always fun to have the bid dumped on you...well, not always...but isn't it fun when this occurs and you have a sweet little run to deal with it?
